reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

description.narrative: Zambia - TB/HIV - Ministry of Health of the Republic of Zambia - MOH. This program has the following goals: Reduce new HIV infections from 51,000 in 2019, by at least 50% by 2023. Reduce AIDS related mortality by 50% in 2023 from 20,000 in 2019. Reduce HIV related stigma and discrimination by 50% in 2023 from the 2019 baseline. Mother to child transmission of HIV eliminated, from 3.7% in 2019 to less than 3%, by 2023. To reduce the number of TB deaths in the population by 40% in 2021 compared to 2015. The objectives of this program are: 95% of PLHIV know their HIV status. 95% of people diagnosed with HIV enrolled on ART. 95% of PLHIV receiving ART achieve viral suppression. To reduce stigma and discrimination associated with HIV and AIDS. To improve access and utilisation of HIV and AIDS servcies by population groups most at risk. To increase the treatment success rate for TB from 90% in 2019 to at least 95% from 2023 onwards. To increase the treatment success rate for multi-drug resistant (MDR) TB patients from 75% in 2019 to 82% by the year 2023
